meanings.definition: To lift or pull something with a sudden movement.
meanings.sent1: She hoiked the bag onto her shoulder.
meanings.sent2: He always hoiks up his pants before walking.
meanings.sent3: The magician hoiked the rabbit out of the hat with flair.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman hoiked the big catch out of the water.
meanings.sent5: With a strong hoik, she lifted the heavy box effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: He felt a hoik on his fishing line.
meanings.sent2: The hoik of the dog's leash startled him.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected hoik made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The hoik of the rope caught him off guard.
meanings.sent5: The hoik of the curtain revealed a hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: To move or pull something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She hoiked the stubborn drawer open.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind hoiked the kite into the air.
meanings.sent3: He hoiked the heavy suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent4: The chef hoiked the pan off the stove in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: With a determined hoik, he moved the boulder out of the way.
